intro: Helicia youngiana var. typica, commonly known as the Chinese holly or Chinese evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and glossy, with a deep green color, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
